intro: Spermacoce willdenowii, commonly known as the African star apple or wild coffee, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, round, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Spermacoce willdenowii is often found in open woodlands and along streambanks, thriving in well-drained soils.
